text: Małgorzata Braunek (30 January 1947 - 23 June 2014) was a Polish actress of movies and stage. She won a Best Supporting Actress Award at the Polish Film Awards for her role in Tulipany (2004). She also had roles in movies such as The Third Part of the Night (1971), The Devil (1972) and The Deluge (1974). Braunek was born in Szamotuły. She graduated from the Ludwik Solski Academy for the Dramatic Arts, Warsaw in 1969. She was married to movie director Andrzej Żuławski. They had a son actor and movie producer, Xawery Żuławski (1971). She was a follower and teacher of Zen Buddhism. Braunek died from cancer in Warsaw on 23 June 2014, aged 67. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Małgorzata Braunek at culture.pl Category:1947 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Buddhists Category:Cancer deaths in Poland Category:Polish movie actors Category:Polish stage actors Category:Polish television actors
title: Małgorzata Braunek
